intro: Dorstenia piscicelliana, commonly known as the fishhook plant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally twisted stems that resemble fishing hooks. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental stems. Dorstenia piscicelliana is also valued for its ability to climb using its twining stems.
